channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ex-aide to N.Y. govs accused of working for China. And Russia’s deadly missile attack
item.description: A key aide to several New York Democratic governors has pleaded not guilty after being accused of working on behalf of China. And, a government reshuffle in Ukraine after deadly Russian missile strike.
item.content:encoded:
A key aide to several New York Democratic governors has pleaded not guilty after being accused of working on behalf of China. And, a government reshuffle in Ukraine after deadly Russian missile strike.

(Image credit: Evgeniy Maloletka)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Could bird flu spread at state fairs? Here’s why health experts advise caution
item.description: Corn dogs, deep-fried Twinkies, butter sculptures and influenza virus? Here’s why state fairs could be potential breeding grounds for viral mutation.
item.content:encoded:
Corn dogs, deep-fried Twinkies, butter sculptures and influenza virus? Here’s why state fairs could be potential breeding grounds for viral mutation.

(Image credit: Benjamin Thorp)
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Thorp

item.title: Ukraine's foreign minister submits resignation as Russian strikes kill 7 in Lviv
item.description: Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba's resignation offer comes days after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned about an imminent Cabinet reshuffle.
item.content:encoded:
Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba's resignation offer comes days after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned about an imminent Cabinet reshuffle.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Here’s why many election experts aren’t freaking out about certification this year
item.description: Watchdog groups and pundits are sounding the alarm about the potential for mischief when it comes to certifying vote tallies, but election experts have confidence in the system's guardrails.
item.content:encoded:
Watchdog groups and pundits are sounding the alarm about the potential for mischief when it comes to certifying vote tallies, but election experts have confidence in the system's guardrails.

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: In a rural small town, a group of locals steps up to support senior health
item.description: Health care options for older adults in small rural towns can be lacking. In Glen Ullin, N.D., some community members are trying to bridge the gaps in care.
item.content:encoded:
Health care options for older adults in small rural towns can be lacking. In Glen Ullin, N.D., some community members are trying to bridge the gaps in care.

(Image credit: Tim Evans for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: This boss vowed to help his workers with child care. It hasn't been easy
item.description: Child care continues to vex working parents. In Wisconsin, the CEO of the Wisconsin Aluminum Foundry has been trying — and struggling — to make a difference.
item.content:encoded:
Child care continues to vex working parents. In Wisconsin, the CEO of the Wisconsin Aluminum Foundry has been trying — and struggling — to make a difference.

(Image credit: Andrea Hsu)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Meet the evangelicals trying to make a case for VP Harris
item.description: More than 80% of white evangelicals supported Donald Trump in 2016 and 2020, but a new group is trying to push some of those voters to the camp of Democratic nominee vice president Kamala Harris.
item.content:encoded:
More than 80% of white evangelicals supported Donald Trump in 2016 and 2020, but a new group is trying to push some of those voters to the camp of Democratic nominee vice president Kamala Harris.

(Image credit: Associated Press)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Emma Navarro reaches her first Grand Slam at the U.S. Open with win over Paula Badosa
item.description: The 13th-seeded Navarro will next face Aryna Sabalenka, while Americans Taylor Fritz and Frances Tiafoe advanced to the semis on the men's side of the tournament.
item.content:encoded:
The 13th-seeded Navarro will next face Aryna Sabalenka, while Americans Taylor Fritz and Frances Tiafoe advanced to the semis on the men's side of the tournament.

(Image credit: Pamela Smith)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Abuse claims trigger a reckoning in India's Mollywood
item.description: A report into sexual assault in one of India's most respected film industries has triggered a #MeToo-style reckoning.
item.content:encoded: A report into sexual assault in one of India's most respected film industries has triggered a #MeToo-style reckoning.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Coastal flooding is getting more common, even on sunny days
item.description: High tide floods – when water collects in streets or even seeps into buildings on days without rain – are increasingly common in coastal areas as sea levels rise, a new report warns.
item.content:encoded:
High tide floods – when water collects in streets or even seeps into buildings on days without rain – are increasingly common in coastal areas as sea levels rise, a new report warns.

(Image credit: Lynne Sladky/AP)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher
